Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の子
Entry.EnglishText: Girl

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズの老剣士
Entry.EnglishText: Old Swordsman

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋「緑の野原」
Entry.EnglishText: Armor Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器屋「北の渓谷」
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: スティーブ
Entry.EnglishText: Steve

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: 装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズ・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: みんなが、ガジュマと ヒューマが仲良くするのは ヘンだって言うのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone's saying that Huma and Gajuma getting along is weird.

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、どうして？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you know why?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか村全体が 妙な雰囲気じゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: This whole village is in a strange funk.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……そういや、あのじいさん 元気かの……
Entry.EnglishText: Come to think of it, I wonder how that old man is holding up...

Entry.JapaneseText: パイのう…… どうしようかのう……
Entry.EnglishText: Pie... What should I do...

Entry.JapaneseText: ポプラさんには 冷たくしたしのう……
Entry.EnglishText: I was so cold to Ms. Poplar...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか集会所の前が 大変な事になってるらしい じゃないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Isn't there an incident going on in front of the Town Hall?

Entry.JapaneseText: ちょっと 見てきておくれよ？
Entry.EnglishText: Maybe you ought to check?

Entry.JapaneseText: パイねえ…… ポプラおばさんは 本当にもう大丈夫なの？
Entry.EnglishText: Pie... Is Ms. Poplar really feeling better?

Entry.JapaneseText: よく来たね、<Veigue>。
Entry.EnglishText: Nice to see you, <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 防具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Armor Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもいらっしゃい。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back anytime.

Entry.JapaneseText: いや、めでたいね、 クレアちゃん、 戻ってきたんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: Claire's back, isn't she? Well, how nice.

Entry.JapaneseText: いやー、めでたいわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Why, how lovely...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたたち、 こんな何もない村に何の用事？
Entry.EnglishText: What business do you have in a sleepy village like Sulz?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>の友達にしては、 なんとなくナリが変だけど……
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue> making friends does seem a little odd...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんな連中に 負けるんじゃないよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You can't lose to those soldiers!

Entry.JapaneseText: ちゃんとうちで 準備していきなよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Make sure to prepare before heading out.

Entry.JapaneseText: 村のみんなが、あんたたちを 応援してるわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You have the support of everyone in the village.

Entry.JapaneseText: 必ずクレアを連れて 戻ってきておくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Bring Claire back!

Entry.JapaneseText: 一体、ガジュマたちは どうしたって言うのかねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: What the hell is wrong with these Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: ポプラおばさんは温厚で陽気で、 とてもいい人だったのにね……
Entry.EnglishText: To think Ms. Poplar was such a sweet, cheerful lady..

Entry.JapaneseText: はぁ……最近、 お客が少なくてね……
Entry.EnglishText: Mhm...Lately, I've hardly had any customers...

Entry.JapaneseText: ポプラおばさんが 元気出してくれないと この村はやっぱりダメかもね……
Entry.EnglishText: If Aunt Poplar doesn't cheer up, Sulz won't fare so well...

Entry.JapaneseText: でもねぇ……
Entry.EnglishText: But...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、いい娘さんがいたら、 スティーブに紹介してやって くれないかい？
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, if you know any nice girls, please introduce them to Steve.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうだい？
Entry.EnglishText: Well?

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、お嬢さん、 ウチの息子のお嫁さんに なってくれないかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Hello ma'am, would you be interested in marrying my son?

Entry.JapaneseText: なかなかイイ男だろ？ そしたら、私も安心して この店、引退できるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: He's a fine man, don't you think? If you do, I'll finally be able to retire from running this store.

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、カワイイお嬢さん、 ウチの息子のお嫁さんに なってくれないかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Hello pretty miss, would you be interested in marrying my son?

Entry.JapaneseText: まだ若いからさ、 今は婚約って事で、どう？
Entry.EnglishText: Since you're still young, it'll just be an engagement. Well?

Entry.JapaneseText: うちの息子のスティーブは、 少し影は薄いけど、 とてもいい子だよ。
Entry.EnglishText: My son Steve is a tad unremarkable, but he's a sweet boy.

Entry.JapaneseText: 男気はあるし、 一本槍だからね。
Entry.EnglishText: He's quite the gentleman.

Entry.JapaneseText: 誰かいい人、お嫁に きてくれないかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you think he'll ever find a nice girl to settle down with...?

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでもいらっしゃい。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back anytime.

Entry.JapaneseText: よその村から お客さんなんて嬉しいな。 さあ、何にする？
Entry.EnglishText: It's nice to have guests from outside the village. Now, what can I get for you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 武器を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Weapons Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくれよな。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you'll come back.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何かおめがねにかなうと いいんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I hoped something will catch your eye...
Entry.Notes: this was changed to be present since it's before you buy anything

Entry.JapaneseText: 買わなくてもいいからさ、 また遊びに来てくれよな。
Entry.EnglishText: Y'know, you don't have to buy anything. Feel free to swing by anytime, okay?

Entry.JapaneseText: クレアが……クレアが 無事に戻って来たって…… あんたたちのおかげかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Is it thanks to you that Claire is back safely?

Entry.JapaneseText: とにかく、めでたいよ！ 一年か……長かったなぁ……！
Entry.EnglishText: Anyway, what a relief! What a long year that was!

Entry.JapaneseText: やっと……やっと元に 戻ったっていうのに…… クレア……<Veigue>……
Entry.EnglishText: After things had finally gotten back to normal for Claire...and <Veigue>...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうか、二人をよろしく お願いします！ 絶対に助けてくれよな！
Entry.EnglishText: Please help <Veigue> save Claire! I'm sure you'll rescue her!

Entry.JapaneseText: がんばってくれよな！ クレアが戻って来ないと モニカのやつも……
Entry.EnglishText: Try your best! If Claire never comes back, then Monica...

Entry.JapaneseText: 前は楽しかったのにな…… どうしてこんな暗い村に なっちまったのかな……
Entry.EnglishText: Things used to be so lighthearted... Why has the village become so gloomy...

Entry.JapaneseText: この村……このままじゃいけない。 それはわかってるんだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: It can't go on like this. We all know that...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、相手がガジュマだって いうだけで、身構えちゃうんだ…… 種族って何なんだろ……
Entry.EnglishText: But just the fact that they're Gajuma is making me feel wary... What exactly is race anyways...

Entry.JapaneseText: この前の地鳴りは すごかったね。
Entry.EnglishText: That earthquake was intense.

Entry.JapaneseText: どこで何が起きたのか、 心配だなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm worried that something might've happened somewhere...

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズは田舎の村だけどさ、 俺は好きなんだよね……
Entry.EnglishText: Sulz is a rural village, but that suits me fine.

Entry.JapaneseText: やあ、<Veigue>。
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, <Veigue>.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 武器を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Weapons Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくれよな。
Entry.EnglishText: I hope you'll come back.

Entry.JapaneseText: いつもすまないな。 何にする？
Entry.EnglishText: What can I do for you?

Entry.JapaneseText: たまには ゆっくり話しようぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Feel free to stop by and chat.

Entry.JapaneseText: よかったな！ <Veigue>！ クレアが元に戻ったんだって？
Entry.EnglishText: I heard the good news, <Veigue>! Looks like Claire's back to normal.

Entry.JapaneseText: スティーブがよろしく言ってたって 伝えといてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Give her my regards.

Entry.JapaneseText: あとで必ず会いに行くからな。 ちゃんとクレアに伝えといてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'll come visit you later. Let Claire know as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえなら、モニカのやつも ちゃんと話を聞くかもしれないな。
Entry.EnglishText: I think Monica might listen if you go talk to her.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんまり無理するなよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Don't feel too pressured about it though...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたら、モニカを 元気づけられるんだろうなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: How can I make Monica feel better...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、モニカの奴、 集会所の前の広場で いつも泣いてるんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Lately, Monica has been standing in front of the Meeting House and crying...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたってんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: What's bothering her?

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか…… みんなの態度がぎこちなくて 肩がこるぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Everybody's being awkward and tense for some reason.

Entry.JapaneseText: お前……なんか悩んでんだろ？ あんまり無理すんなよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Are you...worried about something? Try not to stress too hard.

Entry.JapaneseText: いいんだ……モニカの事は、 そっとしておくしかないよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Okay...I guess I'll just have to leave Monica alone...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、モニカの奴、 集会所の前の広場で いつも泣いてるんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Lately, Monica has been standing in front of the Meeting House and crying...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたってんだろ？
Entry.EnglishText: What's bothering her?

Entry.JapaneseText: あ……さっきは<Veigue>が 帰ってきてるって聞いたから、 見にいっただけで、パイの香りに つられたってわけじゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah...earlier I heard that <Veigue> had come back, I wanted to see him but then that pie lured me in...

Entry.JapaneseText: え？ ポプラおばさんのパイ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? Ms. Poplar's Pie...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、まあ、そこまで言うなら 食べてやらない事もないぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: Well, if you insist. There's nothing I can't eat...

Entry.JapaneseText: さっきの地鳴りは すごかったな。
Entry.EnglishText: That earthquake was intense.

Entry.JapaneseText: 少し怖かったけど、 モニカが俺を 頼ってきてくれたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: It scared me a little, but Monica depends on me.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺があいつを 守ってやらなきゃって思ったら、 急に勇気が湧いてきてさ。
Entry.EnglishText: When I thought about how I need to protect her, I found some courage.

Entry.JapaneseText: 守るべきものがあるっていうのは こういう事なんだろうな。
Entry.EnglishText: So this is what it's like to have something you want to protect.

Entry.JapaneseText: 情けないけど、さっきの地鳴り、 かなり怖かったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: It's embarrassing to admit, but that earthquake earlier scared me pretty good.

Entry.JapaneseText: こんなんじゃダメだ、俺……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't do this, I...

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近は特別、 変わった事はないなあ……
Entry.EnglishText: Nothing's really been going on lately...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>……モニカの事を ゆるしてやってくれないか？
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>...can you forgive Monica?

Entry.JapaneseText: どういう事だ？
Entry.EnglishText: What are you talking about?

Entry.JapaneseText: あいつは……自分を責め続けてる。 クレアやヴェイグたちに すまない事をしたって……
Entry.EnglishText: She keeps beating herself up, saying that she did something awful to you and Claire...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんとか励ましたいんだけど、 話すらしてくれないんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I wanted to cheer her up myself, but she won't even talk to me.

Entry.JapaneseText: 「ごめんスティーブ、 そっとしておいて……」 ……の一点張りでな……
Entry.EnglishText: "I'm sorry Steve, I don't want to talk about it..." That's what she kept telling me...

Entry.JapaneseText: よかったな<Veigue>！ クレアを無事に 連れ戻す事ができて！
Entry.EnglishText: How wonderful that Claire came back safely, <Veigue>!

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、心配かけたな。 これで、モニカも元気に なったんじゃないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah, that was quite the scare. Well, is Monica feeling better now that she's back?

Entry.JapaneseText: それが……相変わらずだよ。 話もしてくれないし、 ニコリとも笑わない。
Entry.EnglishText: She's...still the same. She still won't talk to me, and she won't laugh or smile.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたら、前みたいに 元気になってくれるんだ？ せめて、話ができればなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: How can I help her be chipper like before? If only she'd talk to me...

Entry.JapaneseText: その後、モニカはどうだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Any updates on Monica?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……もういいよ、 モニカの事は……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm just...the whole situation with Monica...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: What's the matter?

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺にはモニカを励ます事すら できないんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: I can't cheer Monica up at all...

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺にできるのは、モニカを 見守ってやる事だけだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: All I can do is keep an eye out for her...

Entry.JapaneseText: スティーブ……
Entry.EnglishText: Steve...
